sentences.sContent: It looked like a sphere but on closer examination I saw it was really a spheroid.
sentences.sContent_eng: It looked like a sphere but on closer examination I saw it was really a spheroid.
sentences.sCn: 它看起来是圆形，但仔细观察后发现它实际上是回转椭球体。

sentences.sContent: This little spheroid sports thousands of tiny hairs around the outer edge of its body called cilia that propel it at lightning speeds through freshwater scum.
sentences.sContent_eng: This little spheroid sports thousands of tiny hairs around the outer edge of its body called cilia that propel it at lightning speeds through freshwater scum.
sentences.sCn: 这个小小的球状体的身体外壳上有着上千条细小的发丝，叫做纤毛，推进它以闪电般的速度穿行于淡水泡沫中。

sentences.sContent: The difference of the marks between the geoid and the spheroid is determined by the direction of geological processes in upper envelopes of the earth.
sentences.sContent_eng: The difference of the marks between the geoid and the spheroid is determined by the direction of geological processes in upper envelopes of the earth.
sentences.sCn: 地球体与球体之间标志的差异，是由地球外壳中地质作用的方向所确定的。

remMethod.val: spher (球) + oid (相似的) → 球状体

trans.tranOther: a shape that is similar to a ball, but not perfectly round
